main event: An unidentified object, described as triangular with blue-white lights on each corner, was observed in the sky by a control tower operator at Nahant, Massachusetts on 23 June 1952. The object was moving at a high speed and was observed for about 2 minutes before disappearing. It passed within approximately 5 miles of Nahant at an altitude of 1,500 to 2,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was described as triangular in shape with fixed blue-white lights on each corner, a unique and unusual characteristic for an aerial object.
The observation was made by a control tower operator, suggesting a credible witness with experience in identifying aerial phenomena.
The object was observed for about 2 minutes, allowing for a relatively detailed and prolonged sighting.
The sudden disappearance of the object adds a mysterious element to the sighting, raising questions about its nature and capabilities.
The object passed within a close proximity (5 miles) of Nahant, Massachusetts, at a significant altitude (1,500 to 2,000 feet), indicating a close encounter.
sighted object: triangular object with fixed blue-white lights on each corner
